TopicTitle: If i have a lot of ship in orbit, or;

Articles.Content:
if i'm looking to a big craft (like ISS, or the navy carrier)

My pc can't handle game:[ What should I do? If i upgrade rams will it fix?

I am using Lenovo y560(4GB) My ram slots are ddr3.

Sorry I can't speak english well.

Try lowering your graphic settings, it might help.

Also I don't think that upgrading the RAM would help, the game limit is 4GB. (From what I remember).
you should try to upgrade your graphics card. Due to the game's architecture, it can't even use 4GB of ram if it had to.

if i'm looking to a big craft (like ISS, or the navy carrier)

My pc can't handle game:[ What should I do? If i upgrade rams will it fix?

I am using Lenovo y560(4GB) My ram slots are ddr3.

Sorry I can't speak english well.

Its probably your proccessor since I think your on a laptop, I don't know if you can upgrade.

Try lowering your graphic settings, it might help.

Also I don't think that upgrading the RAM would help, the game limit is 4GB. (From what I remember).

I'm playing at lowest settings:[
Upgrading the ram, to 6 or 8gb should help a little. The game can't use more than 4gb but with windows using some having extra couldn't hurt. But the game is general cpu limited. Not ram limited.

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16834146777

Is this your laptop? If it is then it could easily just be the part count causing you to have issues with lag. Don't feel bad about it, we all have this issue.

I'm playing at lowest settings:[

Your processor is horrible so is your ghz, You won't get crap out of that Sorry

and your laptop has bad reviews.. Don't know what you were thinking when you bought it.
